newsitem.title: HONG KONG: PRESS DIGEST - HK newspaper headlines - June 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - HK newspaper headlines - June 23.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Hong Kong press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- APPLE DAILY -- Hong Kong Chief Executive-designate Tung Chee-hwa denied that he had any problem working with Chief Secretary Anson Chan, who will be his deputy after the handover.

-- MING PAO -- Local Japanese banks are more worried about a possible plunge by Hong Kong's property prices than the handover. They fear that in five years' time, Hong Kong may experience what happened in Japan in the early 1990s.

-- WEN WEI PO - Preparation work for a nuclear power plant, to be China's biggest, in Lianyugang in China's Jiangsu province is going on. China and Russia will expand their cooperation in power development.
-- SOUTH CHINA MORNING POST -- Fears that China's plan to cool the red-chip sector could cause confusion in the stock market has sparked calls for more details about Beijing's new regulations.

-- HONGKONG STANDARD -- Sources said Beijing was expected to call for an exchange of visits between top Chinese and British leaders in an effort to improve frosty relations. The call was expected to be made at meetings before the handover ceremony.
